name: MARIN RIFT ZONE 1 BIKE 2022

specifications.Rear Shock: X-Fusion O2 Pro R, Custom Tune, 210 x 50mm
specifications.Wheelset: Marin Aluminum Double Wall Rims, Shimano MT200B/MT400B Hubs
specifications.Tires: Vee Tire Crown Gem, 29 x 2.3" TR

reviews.reviewText: I am brand new to mountain biking but athletic and this bike is perfect so far. It’s super fun to ride, and came assembled perfectly. I had a local bike shop give me a run through, and they checked assembly to be sure and everything was solid. I got a medium, and am 5’7” with long legs. I will add a dropper post someday, but so far so good!

This is my first full suspension mountain bike and I've been riding hard tails for about two decades now. I absolutely love the way this bike handles curves and uphill and downhill. I've been able to climb better with the full  suspension than I would have with my old hard tails. It feels easier to handle and the ride is smoother. It's very light. It does nicely on jumps and step downs too. I'm able to control the bike better.  For reference I'm 6'2 280 lbs and I went with the XL and it was the best choice for me.

Just finished my first ride with this bike.  I love it.  Yes you can buy a nicer bike, but for the money this is a nice ride.  My only take away is that it should come with a dropper but for the price its not a huge deal.

You can find a better full suspension MTB in this price range.....insane value for the price. I was frozen in analysis paralysis between the Marin RZ1 vs. the Giant Stance and I couldn't be happier with my RZ1-29er. I'm 6' even and 170-175lbs depending on pizza consumption, so I'm riding size large.  I've been running downhill, technical climbs, flow and rump trails, and a bit of rugged XC, and this bike takes it all in stride.Pros:Both the front and rear shock have been more adjustable than I would have expected. The slack head angle makes the slow technical XC trails a little tricky, but it provides huge benefits for climbing and speedy descents.Cons:There really isn't much to dislike, but its worth mentioning that the RZ1 does not come with a dropper post. And the stock seat post is sure long, so you cant lower the seat all the way without cutting the post down  significantly. That's an easy process with a hack saw and a file, but you can add a dropper for under $200 if you self-install.Overall, I cant recommend the RZ1 highly enough. If you're in the market for an affordable full suspension MTB then the Marin RZ1 is a smart place to invest your hard-earned coin.
Fantastic bike. A perfect "entry level" serious mountain bike.

Ok, I've been riding on and off for a really long time.  Always had a hardtail.  I finally decided to spoil myself and get this Marin rift zone 1.  I've ridden it a few times and I cant help smiling the whole time on on it.  I know this is not some state of the art ground shaking bike.  It's all I needed.  Love it.
This bike thrives downhill and jumping! Does okay climbing. Very playful and nimble bike. I love the stand over height and short chainstay.

So far, the bike works great! The only thing I wished was different was the breaks. It takes a while to stop this bike and a dropper post would be great too, but I guess you get what you pay for. Everything else works perfect. I just hope it lasts a few years without breaking.
Excelente bicicleta WAAAOOO,  me encanta es otra cosa

marketingHype: Trail riding is all about having fun. Trail bikes are designed to climb efficiently and descend with ease. The Marin Rift Zone 1 Bike is a speed-oriented bike that is created for the rider looking for the speed and rollover capabilities of 29" wheels in a trail-capable package. It has a Series 3 6061 aluminum frame that has 125mm of travel on the rear and 130mm of travel on the front. The frame features Boost spacing, has ISCG05 tabs, and has internal cable routing.

The Rift Zone 1 comes with a Shimano Deore 11-speed drivetrain that includes a cassette that has a hill-crushing 11-51T gear range that makes climbing and riding in rough terrain a breeze. Shimano BR-MT201 hydraulic disc brakes provide excellent stopping power so you can descend under control. Marin aluminum double-wall rims are paired with Vee Tire Crown Gem tires that can be set up tubeless so you can ditch the tubes and drop the tire pressure for a smoother ride, better traction, and fewer flats.
features: Series 3 6061 aluminum frame with MultiTrac Suspension, Boost spacing, and ISCG05 tabs
Shimano Deore drivetrain performs well in demanding terrain
Shimano MT201 hydraulic disc brakes provide confidence-inspiring stopping power
Tubeless-ready rims and tires for a smoother ride, better traction, and fewer flats
Internal cable routing for a rattle-free and clean cable set up
